sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine ‚Äî For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Let‚Äôs welcome the new month with some fresh desktop wallpapers. Designed by artists and designers from around the globe, they come in versions with and without a calendar for July 2023. Enjoy!
articles.title: Off To New Adventures (July 2023 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: The design process is messy. You might be following a structured approach, but too often, it takes a life of its own. And before you know it, you are designing in chaos, with last-minute changes and missed deadlines. So, what‚Äôs the ‚Äúperfect‚Äù design process?
articles.title: What‚Äôs The Perfect Design Process?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Patrick Brosset)
articles.description: Let‚Äôs discover the most popular DevTools tips that can boost your productivity and revolutionize your debugging workflow.
articles.title: Useful DevTools Tips and Tricks

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Miko≈Çaj Dobrucki)
articles.description: In today‚Äôs article, let‚Äôs explore how we can use Flex Layout and see how it empowers designers with greater control over their work while saving everyone‚Äôs time.
articles.title: Penpot‚Äôs Flex Layout: Building CSS Layouts In A Design Tool

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Geoff Graham)
articles.description: The Wikipedia team shipped a redesign of the ubiquitous and one of the [most visited websites](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_most_visited_websites) on the web. Alex Hollendar and Jon Robson led the work and generously discussed the effort with us in a thorough, wide-ranging interview that covers the design, development, and processes that went into the project.
articles.title: Behind The Curtains Of Wikipedia Redesign

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Joas Pambou)
articles.description: Dive into an article where you will build an app that evaluates audio files for positive and negative sentiments. The idea is that you will create an interface for uploading an audio file, then transcribe the contents into text before analyzing the text and assigning it a positive or negative score for how the tone is perceived.
articles.title: Using AI To Detect Sentiment In Audio Files

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Scott Gallant)
articles.description: Visual editing is beginning to make its way into headless architecture and the early results look promising. We‚Äôll look at a few headless CMSs that currently support visual editing in this article.
articles.title: Visual Editing Comes To The Headless CMS

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Juan Diego Rodr√≠guez)
articles.description: Part 2 of the series concentrates on implementing internationalization (i18n) on a Gatsby website, an essential feature on any multilingual website that can be quite a bit of trouble if incorrectly implemented, creating more problems than it solves.
articles.title: Gatsby Headaches And How To Cure Them: i18n (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ren Chen)
articles.description: One way of getting a more behind-the-scenes experience of any Smashing event is to apply as a volunteer, and Ren did just that! The SmashingConf team organized a conference in good ol‚Äô San Francisco this year, and here‚Äôs pretty much how it went down.
articles.title: What Was SmashingConf In San Franciso Like?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Geoff Graham)

It‚Äôs got a lot of low-code features that level the playing field for app development but is really designed for React developers. How so, you ask? That‚Äôs what we‚Äôre going to explore in this article.

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Sriram Thiagarajan)
articles.description: SvelteKit is a framework for building apps using Svelte. In this article, Sriram shows you how to build a server-side rendered (SSR) SvelteKit application and deploy it to Netlify by following this step-by-step guide.
articles.title: How To Build Server-Side Rendered (SSR) Svelte Apps With SvelteKit

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)

articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 62 With Slava Shestopalov: What Is Design Management?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Paul Boag)
